static void enableAll()
          Enables all the servos by setting them to their middle/center positions, unless they are already enabled, in which case it leaves them alone.

Enables all the servos by setting them to their middle/center positions, unless they are already enabled, in which case it leaves them alone.

getPosition

public int getPosition()
Gets the current servo's position.

Returns:
-1 if the servo is disabled, otherwise the current position.

rawSetPosition

protected void rawSetPosition(int pos)
Change the position of the servo without touching the isMoving value

setPosition

public void setPosition(int pos,
                        boolean blocking)
Moves the servo to the desired position, waiting for it to finish moving before stopping.

Implementation Note: As we have no api for actually determining when a servo is done moving, an forumula respecting the distance to be traveled is used to approximate the time, and then the function sleeps for that desired time.

Specified by:
setPosition in interface IBlockingAdvancedStateMotor
Overrides:
setPosition in class AbstractBlockingAdvancedStateMotor
Parameters:
pos - The position value from 0 to 2048 to move to

isMoving

public boolean isMoving()
Returns a boolean that tells if the servo is moving or not.

Returns:
True is moving, false is not moving

setPositionTime

public void setPositionTime(int newPos,
                            int ms,
                            boolean blocking)
Moves to a new servo position in a designated amount of time in milliseconds. The speed of the movement is simulated by running quickly changing the motor positions to intermediate places over time.

Specified by:
setPositionTime in interface IBlockingAdvancedStateMotor
Overrides:
setPositionTime in class AbstractBlockingAdvancedStateMotor
Parameters:
ms - the allotted amount of time to move
newPos - the new servo position

update

public void update()
Do not use.

getDefaultSpeed

public int getDefaultSpeed()
Needed to extend AbstractBlockingAdvancedStateMotor. It makes little sense in this context.

Specified by:
getDefaultSpeed in class AbstractAdvancedStateMotor
Returns:
Some really big number.

getMinPosition

public int getMinPosition()
Gives the minimum rotational position that the the servo can move to.

Returns:
Zero. Always zero. Zip. Nothing. Nada. 0.

getMaxPosition

public int getMaxPosition()
Gives the maximum rotational position that the the servo can move to.

Returns:
2048

getPort

public int getPort()
The port that the servo that this object is addressing should be plugged into.
